intro: Schwantesia cognata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock fig, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. It produces edible fig-like fruits that are typically green when mature. Schwantesia cognata is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments.
